name: CISCO METHODOLOGY [Configuration From TFTP]
description: This rule looks for network devices that loaded a configuration file over TFTP. TFTP (Trivial File Transfer Protocol) is a UDP-based file transfer protocol commonly used by network devices for firmware and configuration transfers. Attackers who compromise network devices like routers and switches may load a malicious configuration via TFTP and exfiltrate data or download malware. If this rule triggers an alert, investigate the TFTP server that the configuration was loaded from and determine if this is expected behavior. An unfamiliar TFTP server, especially an external one, may indicate suspicious activity. This rule may require tuning if it fires on legitimate activity.
tags: tftp,cisco,Remote File Copy,Command and Control,Ingress Tool Transfer,T1105,md-info
query: class:cisco* rawmsg:`Configured from tftp://` NOT srcipv4:$exclusions.global.srcipv4
